RMP PLAN

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Univar USA Inc. is a wholesale chemical distributor serving a wide variety of U.S. industries.  Founded in 1924, Univar USA Inc. supplies the water and waste water industry, food industry, compounders, pharmaceuticals, mining, forest products, oil and gas producers, electronics, coatings and many other key industries with the chemical raw materials required to produce or refine products utilized in numerous end-use markets.

Univar USA Inc. is a member of the National Association of Chemical distributors (NACD) and complies with the Responsible Distribution Process (RDP), an environmental, health and safety improvement initiative.

Some of the products stored and handled by Univar USA Inc. are subject to EPA's Risk Management Program rule (40 CFR Part 68).  A key requirement of this rule is the preparation and submission of an RMP Plan, contained herein. The contents of the RMP plan are prescribed by EPA, including this Executive Summary.

CORPORATE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE APPROACH


PREVENTION PROGRAM
Processes that are subject to OSHA's Process Safety management (PSM) standard AND are regulated under EPA's RMP rule are subject to the Program 3 Prevention program.  Univar USA Inc. has documented the Prevention Program in its Process Safety Management Manual. Briefly, this program includes provisions and requirements for:

* Process Safety Information
* Process Hazard Analysis
* Operating Procedures
* Training
* Mechanical Integrity
* Management of Change
* Pre-Startup Review
* Compliance Audits
* Incident Investigation
* Employee Participation
* Hot Work permits
* Contractors

EMERGENCY RESPONSE APPROACH

Univar USA Inc. has an Emergency Contingency Plan in place.  This Plan is shared with local emergency responders who have access to Univar USA inc. facility personnel.  Univar USA Inc. responds to minor incidents but will call in professional emergency responders in the event of all other incidents.

Univar

USA Inc. invites and encourages local emergency responders such as the fire department to visit and familiarize themselves with Univar USA Inc. products and facilities.  Joint emergency exercises are conducted when possible.

STATIONARY SOURCE

The Providence, Rhode Island site stores, handles and delivers a variety of hazardous and non-hazardous chemical products to wholesale customers in New England. In addition, bleach and dilute ammonia solutions are also processed and distributed. The facility handles formaldehyde solution, chlorine, anhydrous ammonia and aqueous ammonia solutions above the threshold planning quantity limits. 

GENERAL PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS
As outlined previously, Univar USA Inc. is subject to OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation and utilizes this program to meet the prevention program requirements under RMP.

Chemical-specific prevention steps include the following:
1. The maintenance of minimal practical inventories.
2. Employee training and operating procedures.
3. Employee release detection and mitigation activities.
4. Equipment and containers designed to meet appropriate regulatory guidelines  


ACCIDENT HISTORY
The facility has experienced no accidents as specified in 40 CFR Part 68 related to the containerized storage and handling of RMP chemicals in the previous 5 years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
An emergency contingency plan has been prepared and made available to local emergency response agencies.  The Providence Fire Department is familiar with and periodically visits the site.  The facility can utilize local emergency response contractors to provide onsite and offsite emergency response services in the event of a release.
